page.topic: How to Render a UX Control with Panels in a div
page.description: When a UX component that has Panels is rendered, it consumes the entire window. In certain cases you might want to constrain the UX component to a particular element.

discussion.p: The *[ui:Render position type for UX component with Panels]* property allows you to constrain a UX with Panels to a specified element. The default for this property is 'window'. However, this can be changed to specify that the UX Component should be rendered within the bounds of an element on the page, such as a div on an .a5w page.
